feed.title: NewsTracker: egypt
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Egypt military says roadside bomb kills 4 troops in Sinai
entry.summary: Egypt is battling a widening insurgency that has largely targeted troops in northern Sinai.

entry.title: Kerry says United States, Egypt return to 'stronger base' in ties
entry.summary: "Egypt remains vital ... to engagement and stability in the region as a whole," said Kerry, who held the first bilateral strategic dialogue since 2009.

entry.title: Kerry says US, Egypt return to 'stronger base' in ties
Kerry says United States, Egypt return to "stronger base" in ties
entry.summary: Washington supports former general Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, who led Mursi's overthrow and was elected to succeed him, but has cautiously criticized Egypt's human rights record.

entry.title: Egypt postpones Al Jazeera retrial verdict to Aug. 29
US, Egypt resume formal security talks with Kerry visit
US, Egypt resume formal security talks with Kerry visit
entry.summary:
U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry, left, and Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry speak at a press conference after their meeting at the foreign ministry in Cairo, Egypt, Sunday, Aug. 2, 2015.

The United States and Egypt on Sunday resumed formal security talks that were last held six years ago and kept on hiatus until now amid the political unrest that swept the country in the wake of the Arab Spring.

entry.title: Islamic State claims rocket attack on Egypt navy vessel left ablaze after shootout
entry.summary: Sinai Province, the most lethal militant group in Egypt, last year pledged loyalty to Isil, which controls large tracts of territory in Syria and Iraq and has a presence in Egypt's neighbour Libya.

entry.title: Egypt raises death toll from Nile boat collision to 35
entry.summary: Egyptians look at the passenger boat that sunk in the river Nile in Giza, south of Cairo, Egypt, Thursday, July 23, 2015.

entry.title: Croatian man kidnapped in Egypt; said to be energy worker
entry.summary: ZAGREB, Croatia (AP) - A Croatian man has been kidnapped in Egypt by an unidentified armed group, Croatia's foreign ministry said Friday.

entry.title: Egypt raises death toll from Nile boat collision to 31
Egypt death toll rises to 17 in Nile collision; 2 detained
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) " Egypt's health ministry says the death toll from a collision of two boats on the Nile the night before has risen to 17, after two more bodies were retrieved from the river.

entry.title: Egypt death toll rises to 17 in Nile collision; 2 detained
15 drowned when boats collided on the Nile in Egypt
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) " Egypt's Interior ministry says at least 15 civilians have drowned when a passenger boat traveling down the Nile near Cairo collided with a scow, causing the boat to capsize.

entry.title: 15 drowned when boats collided on the Nile in Egypt
Mubarak-Era Premier Gets 5 Years in Egypt Corruption Case
Top Egypt militant urges holy war against Egyptian president
Egypt's military spokesman says 7 soldiers killed in Sinai
entry.summary: Egypt's military spokesman says the death toll from the Sinai Peninsula a day earlier has climbed to seven soldiers after a series of Islamic-State claimed attacks.

entry.title: Muslim Brotherhood supporters killed as violence boils over in Egypt
entry.summary: Twenty Brotherhood members were arrested in Egypt's second city Alexandria, said MENA.

entry.title: Islamic State affiliate Sinai Province claims attack on Egypt navy vessel
entry.summary: Cairo: Egypt's Islamic State affiliate said on Thursday it fired a rocket at an Egyptian naval vessel in the Mediterranean Sea near the coast of Israel and the Gaza Strip.

entry.title: Islamic State affiliate Sinai Province claims attack on Egypt navy vessel
entry.summary: Such incidents at sea are rare, though Egypt is battling an increasingly brazen Islamist insurgency in the peninsula that lies between Israel, the Gaza Strip and the Suez Canal.

entry.title: ISIL affiliate in Egypt says it destroyed one of country?s navy vessels with rocket fire
entry.summary:
CAIRO - The Islamic State's affiliate in Egypt's Sinai says it has destroyed an Egyptian navy vessel with a rocket off the strategic peninsula's Mediterranean coast.

Egypt's military spokesman, Brig.

entry.title: Egyptian Cabinet decides to rename square where Islamists protested to honor slain prosecutor
entry.summary: CAIRO - Egypt's Cabinet has decided to rename a square where security forces broke up a pro-Islamist sit-in two years ago in honor of the country's chief prosecutor, who was assassinated last month.

entry.title: Egypt Decides to Rename Square to Honor Slain Prosecutor
Egypt army says it foils attack on road to Red Sea coast
entry.summary:
Egypt's armed forces said they foiled an attempted attack Wednesday on a military post on a highway linking Cairo with the Red Sea coast that was claimed by Islamic State affiliates.

Officials from several branches of Egypt's security forces previously told The Associated Press that that attack killed dozens more.

entry.title: Egypt Army Says It Foils Attack on Road to Red Sea Coast
Film legend Omar Sharif gets solemn sendoff in Egypt
entry.summary: "Omar Sharif represented Egypt to the world in the best possible way," said Hussein Fahmy, a popular Egyptian actor who attended the funeral.

entry.title: Egyptian lawyers protest colleague's shooting at courthouse
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - Members of Egypt's lawyers union say it has suspended work in Cairo's Nasr City criminal court to protest a police officer shooting a lawyer there.

entry.title: Car bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's capital kills 1
entry.summary: Italian Foreign Minister Paolo Gentiloni said that Italy would increase security at Italian sites in Cairo and greater Egypt.

entry.title: Car bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's capital kills 1
entry.summary: No group immediately claimed responsibility for the blast, though Egypt faces threats from insurgent factions including an Islamic State affiliate in its restive Sinai Peninsula that the military says killed at least 17 soldiers in a recent assault there.

entry.title: Car Bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's Capital Kills 1
entry.summary: A policeman stands at the base of the crumbled facade of the Italian consulate following a blast that killed at least one person in Cairo, Egypt, Saturday, July 11, 2015.

entry.title: Car bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's capital kills 1
entry.summary: Italian Premier Matteo Renzi spoke with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi after the attack, saying in a statement: "We will not leave Egypt alone: Italy and Egypt are and will always be together in the fight against terrorism."

entry.title: Omar Sharif, of "Doctor Zhivago," "Lawrence of Arabia," dies
entry.summary: Yousra, Egypt's biggest actress for much of the past 30 years and a close friend of Sharif, compared Sharif to a "clean-cut" diamond.

entry.title: 'Lawrence of Arabia' actor Omar Sharif dies at 83
entry.summary:
Sharif was Egypt's biggest box-office star when David Lean cast him in 1962's "Lawrence of Arabia," but he was a virtual unknown elsewhere.

The 1968 film was banned in his native Egypt because he was cast as a Jew.

Born Michael Shalhoub in Egypt's Mediterranean coastal city of Alexandria, Sharif was the son of Christian Syrian-Lebanese parents.

Some of Egypt's most iconic film posters are of Hamama and Sharif.

entry.title: Roadside bomb injures 20 policemen in the restive north of Egypt's Sinai
entry.summary: AL-ARISH, Egypt - Security officials say 20 policemen were injured when their bus and armored personnel carrier were hit by a roadside bomb in the turbulent north of Egypt's Sinai Peninsula.

entry.title: Egypt anti-terror bill speeds trials, tightens hand on media
entry.summary: The leaked copy of the bill brought an outcry and demands for changes in the draft from Egypt's journalists union and from senior judges.

entry.title: Egypt anti-terror bill speeds trials, tightens hand on media
entry.summary:
Since Egypt has not had a parliament for more than two years, laws are issued by the president, Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi, after going through the Cabinet.

The New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists has said that at least 18 journalists were behind bars in Egypt as of June 1 and accused the government of using the pretext of national security to crackdown on freedoms.

entry.title: Egypt's currency drops to new low against the dollar
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) " Egypt's central bank says the Egyptian pound has fallen to a new low against the dollar, its second such drop since Thursday.

entry.title: IS in Egypt claims rocket attack on Israel
entry.summary: Egypt's military deployed F-16 warplanes to bombard IS jihadists who battled troops after launching their surprise dawn attack.

entry.title: Egypt foiled extremist 'state' in Sinai, president says
entry.summary:
It came in a week of bloodletting that saw Egypt's prosecutor general assassinated outside his Cairo home by a massive car bomb, and a special forces raid on an apartment that killed nine members of the outlawed Muslim Brotherhood.

Egypt routinely blames the Muslim Brotherhood for violent attacks in the country.

entry.title: Rockets land in Israel, Egypt's IS affiliate claims responsibility
entry.summary: Islamic State's Egypt affiliate, Sinai Province, said in a statement posted on Twitter by supporters that it had launched three Grad rockets toward "occupied Palestine".

entry.title: Egypt marks 2nd anniversary of Islamist ouster with mourning
entry.summary: Two years to the day after the army overthrew Egypt's Islamist president, the sounds coming from the mosque at Cairo's Tahrir Square were sadly telling.
